band_app.apps module

class band_app.apps.BandAppConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration class for the ‘band_app’ application.

This class defines the configuration for the ‘band_app’ Django application including the default settings for database fields and the app’s name. It inherits from AppConfig, which allows Django to manage application-specific settings.

default_auto_field

Specifies the type of auto-generated field to

Type:

str

use for primary keys in models. By default, this is set to
'django.db.models.BigAutoField', which provides a 64-bit integer field.
name

The full Python path to the application, in this case,

Type:

str

'band_app'. This helps Django locate the app in the project.
default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'band_app'

band_app.views module

band_app.views.band_members(request)[source]

Display all band members.

This view retrieves all band members from the database and displays them on the band members page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered band members page with the list of members.

Return type:

HttpResponse

band_app.views.events(request)[source]

Display all events.

This view fetches all events related to the band from the database and renders them on the events page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered events page with the list of events.

Return type:

HttpResponse

band_app.views.home(request)[source]

Render the homepage.

This view handles the rendering of the main homepage of the application. It serves as the entry point for users exploring the band-related app.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered homepage.

Return type:

HttpResponse

band_app.views.register(request)[source]

Handle user registration and login after successful creation.

This view handles user registration by displaying a form for account creation. If the form is valid (submitted via POST), it creates the new user, logs them in, and redirects to the homepage.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The registration page on GET or a redirect to the homepage on successful registration.

Return type:

HttpResponse

band_app.views.user_login(request)[source]

Handle user authentication and login.

This view processes login attempts. On a POST request with valid credentials, it authenticates the user, logs them in, and redirects them to the homepage.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The login page on GET or a redirect to the homepage on successful login.

Return type:

HttpResponse

band_app.views.user_logout(request)[source]

Log the user out and redirect to the homepage.

This view handles the user logout process. Once the logout is completed, the user is redirected back to the homepage.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A redirect to the homepage after successful logout.

Return type:

HttpResponse
